Event.name: Smuggling
Event.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe situations in which the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> secretly takes <fen>Goods</fen> into or out of a country or other area which are prohibited by law or on which one has not paid the required duty.
<ex><fex name="Perpetrator">He</fex> <t>smuggled</t> <fex name="Goods">the bottle</fex> <fex name="Path">through customs</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Perpetrator
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the person (or other agent) that illegally takes the goods into or out of a country.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goods
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be illegally taken into our out of a country.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The source is the location the goods occupy initially before change of location.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>The path refers to (a part of the) ground the Goods travel over or to a landmark the Goods travel by.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>Goal is the location the Goods end up in.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act of the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> which allows them to smuggle the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>A description of the <fen>Event</fen> not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In most cases, it indicates salient characteristics of a <fen>Perpetrator</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>The rebels had <fex name="Manner">secretly</fex> <t>smuggled</t> in several tonnes of explosives.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is trying to accomplish by the act of smuggling.
<ex>We <t>smuggled</t> you in here <fex name="Purp">to try to help</fex> but ...</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that a smuggling event occurs.
<ex>Inmates <fex name="Frequency">frequently</fex> <t>smuggle</t> marijuana into the prison</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Constant_location
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The container, vehicle, or other entity that the <fen>Goods</fen> move with and remain stationary with respect to.
<ex>She 'll <t>smuggle</t> them <fex name="Constant_location">in suit cases</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The amount of time per distance travelled by the <fen>Goods</fen>.
<ex>They <t>smuggled</t> the bomb <fex name="Speed">swiftly</fex> through customs.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: smuggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move (goods) illegally into or out of a country.

lexUnit.name: smuggling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or instances of moving (goods) illegally into or out of a country

lexUnit.name: smuggler.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who moves (goods) illegally into or out of a country

lexUnit.name: contraband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: goods that have been imported or exported illegally.
